result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Michael Taggart

defendant.name: Taggart, Ryan Michael
defendant.address: 3575 East Norwich Court, St Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Michael Taggart in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Ryan Michael Taggart.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. 
Case is adjourned to 11-9-22 at 8:30 am for scheduling conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ryan Michael Taggart in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Ryan Michael Taggart.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Kiefer.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Havas, Br. 10. Parties sent to Branch 10 forthwith.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court MODIFIES the no contact order. Order signed and filed.

Defendant Ryan Michael Taggart in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad appeared by video for Ryan Michael Taggart.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel was recently retained and requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Defense requests a modification to the no contact order. State does not object. Court GRANTS request. Parties to submit a proposed order to the court. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 089243,
Payable Number: 1033288,
Receipt Number: 22RP037726,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Ryan Michael Taggart in court.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant's circumstances have changed and defendant IS eligible for PD representation. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Court ordered no contact with PP (10/25/84).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Ryan Michael Taggart in court with attorney Theodore D. Kafkas.  Defendant Ryan Michael Taggart in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ryan Michael Taggart appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
